penalty.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a punishment for breaking a law, rule, or legal agreement
penalty.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Withdrawing the money early will result in a 10% penalty.
If he is convicted, he could receive the death penalty (=be killed as a punishment).
The penalty for a first offense is a fine.
penalty.translation[0].definitions[1].de: something bad that happens to you because of something you have done or because of the situation you are in
penalty.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: If you don’t do the job right, you will pay the penalty.
One of the penalties of being famous is the loss of privacy.
penalty.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a disadvantage in sports given to a player or team for breaking a rule
penalty.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a chance to kick the ball or hit the puck into the goal in a game of football, rugby, or ice hockey, given because the other team has broken a rule
penalty.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Townsend kicked a penalty (=in a rugby game) in the last minute.
